titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8351

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 17 April 1862.

Hon:
Nat Gaither Jr
Sec: of State
Sir

The following changes have taken place with Officers of the Ken: Vols: viz:
Wm Atkisson Surgeon ^is dead^ (date of Com: 13 Novr 1861)
Joseph B. Harris Major Promoted (date of Com: 9 Jan '62
James W. Gauli Capt: Promoted (date of Com: 9 Oct '61)
John S. White Lieut: Promoted ( Do )
Saml B. Pumpelly Lieut Promoted ( Do )

I send five ^seven^ Commissions for record &c
Cyrenius W. Gilmore Capt: 29 Mar 1862 #1
Peter De Gormo 2 Lieut: 15 Mar 1862 #2
Saml B Pumpelly 1 Lieut: 15 Mar 1862 #3
John S. White Capt. Do #4
James W. Gault Major Do #5
Joseph B. Harris Lt Colo Do 36
James S. Hatchett Surgeon 15 April 1862 #7

Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
